page.title: 09 BISTRE
page.content: Squares 9-12 cover part of Bistre parish.With a meaning of{Bishops Cross , and once and Anglo-Saxon township, This administrative unit metioned in the{Domesday Book}still retains the original motte at Tyddyn Farm. The parish was first served by Spon Chapel (lost) and the modern name Spital Fields and Cold Harbour reminds us of this medieval establishment. The present St.Emmanuel's (built 1842) has two daughter churches ;All Saints in Lane End, and St.Cecelia's, Mynydd Isa.The present built up area can be attributed to two factors : 1.19th century collieries at Bron Wylfa, Lexham Green,Padeswood, Spon, and Nant Mawr.(The 1960s saw opencast workings at Greenhill Farm). 2. Late 20th century residential estates built for commuters.
